Typedef Documentation

typedef struct HostentT HostentT

a host lookup structure – uses a callback system to determine when lookup has finished

typedef struct SocketSendCallbackEntryT SocketSendCallbackEntryT

socket send callback entry (internal use only - needs to be public for DirtyCast stress tester)

global socket send callback

typedef struct SocketT SocketT

Function Documentation

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t SockaddrCompare ( struct sockaddr *  addr1,
struct sockaddr *  addr2 
)

Compare two sockaddr structs and see if address is the same. This is different from simple binary compare because only relevent fields are checked.

Parameters
*addr1- address #1
*addr2- address to compare with address #1
Returns
int32_t - zero=no error, negative=error
Version
10/04/99 (GWS) First Version

Referenced by CommUDPConnect().

DIRTYCODE_API uint8_t SockaddrIn6IsIPv4 ( const struct sockaddr *  pSockAddr)

Identify if specified sockaddr is an IPv4-mapped IPv6 address.

Parameters
*pSockAddr- address to identify
Returns
uint8_t - TRUE if the address is IPv4-mapped, else FALSE
Version
04/12/2016 (jbrookes)

Referenced by SocketAddrMapAddress(), and SocketAddrMapTranslate().

char *  str,
int32_t  len 
)

Return Internet address component of sockaddr struct in textual form (a.b.c.d).

Parameters

*str- address buffer
len- address length
Returns
char * - returns str on success, NULL on failure
Version
10/04/99 (GWS) First Version

Referenced by SocketInAddrGetText().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t SockaddrInParse ( struct sockaddr *  sa,
const char *  pParse 
)

Convert textual internet address:port into sockaddr structure. 

If the textual internet address:port is followed by a second :port, the second port
is optionally parsed into pPort2, if not NULL.
Parameters
*sa- sockaddr to fill in
*pParse- textual address
Returns
int32_t - flags: 0=parsed nothing 1=parsed addr 2=parsed port 3=parsed addr+port
Version
11/23/02 (GWS) First Version

References SockaddrInit, SockaddrInParse2(), SockaddrInSetAddr, and SockaddrInSetPort.

Referenced by CommTCPConnect(), and CommTCPListen().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t SockaddrInParse2 ( uint32_t *  pAddr,
int32_t *  pPort,
int32_t *  pPort2,
const char *  pParse 
)

Convert textual internet address:port into sockaddr structure. 

If the textual internet address:port is followed by a second :port, the second port
is optionally parsed into pPort2, if not NULL.
Parameters
*pAddr- address to fill in
*pPort- port to fill in
*pPort2- second port to fill in
*pParse- textual address
Returns
int32_t - flags: 0=parsed nothing 1=parsed addr 2=parsed port 3=parsed addr+port 4=parsed port2
Version
11/23/02 (GWS) First Version

Referenced by CommSRPConnect(), CommSRPListen(), CommUDPConnect(), CommUDPListen(), and SockaddrInParse().

const char *  s 
)

Parameters
*addr- sockaddr structure
*s- textual address
Returns
int32_t - zero=no error, negative=error
Version
10/04/99 (GWS) First Version

Referenced by ProtoSSLConnect(), and SocketInTextGetAddr().

DIRTYCODE_API SocketT* SocketAccept ( SocketT *  pSocket,
struct sockaddr *  pAddr,
int32_t *  pAddrLen 
)

Accept an incoming connection attempt on a socket.

Parameters
*pSocket- socket reference to socket in listening state (see SocketListen())
*pAddr- pointer to storage for address of the connecting entity, or NULL
*pAddrLen- pointer to storage for length of address, or NULL
Returns
SocketT * - the accepted socket, or NULL if not available
Note
The integer pointed to by addrlen should on input contain the number of characters in the buffer addr. On exit it will contain the number of characters in the output address.
Version
10/04/1999 (gschaefer)

References SocketStateT::AddrMap, SocketT::iFamily, SocketT::iLastError, SocketT::iProto, SocketT::iType, NetPrintf, SockaddrInit, SockaddrInit6, SOCKERR_INVALID, SOCKERR_NONE, SocketAddrMapAddress(), SocketAddrMapTranslate(), and SocketT::uSocket.

Referenced by ProtoSSLAccept().

const struct sockaddr *  pName,

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t SocketControl ( SocketT *  pSocket,
int32_t  iOption,
int32_t  iData1,
void *  pData2,
void *  pData3 
)

Process a control message (type specific operation)

Parameters
*pSocket- socket to control, or NULL for module-level option
iOption- the option to pass
iData1- message specific parm
*pData2- message specific parm
*pData3- message specific parm
Returns
int32_t - message specific result (-1=unsupported message, -2=no such module)
Note
iOption can be one of the following:
        'arcv' - set async receive enable/disable (default enabled for DGRAM/RAW, disabled for TCP)
        'conn' - handle connect message
        'disc' - handle disconnect message
        '+ip6' - add an IPv6 address into the mapping table and return a virtual IPv4 address to reference it
        '-ip6' - del an IPv6 address from the mapping table
        '~ip6' - remap an existing IPv6 address in the mapping table
        'keep' - set TCP keep-alive settings on PC (iData1=enable/disable, iData2=keep-alive time, iData3=keep-alive interval)
        'ladr' - set local address for subsequent SocketBind() operations (pc only)
        'maxp' - set max udp packet size
        'maxr' - set max recv rate (bytes/sec; zero=uncapped)
        'maxs' - set max send rate (bytes/sec; zero=uncapped)
        'nbio' - set nonblocking/blocking mode (TCP only, iData1=TRUE (nonblocking) or FALSE (blocking))
        'ndly' - set TCP_NODELAY state for given stream socket (iData1=zero or one)
        'pdev' - set simulated packet deviation
        'plat' - set simulated packet latency
        'plos' - set simulated packet loss
        'poll' - execute blocking wait on given socket list (pData2) or all sockets (pData2=NULL), 64 max sockets
        'pque' - set socket packet queue depth
        'push' - push data into given socket (iData1=size, pData2=data ptr, pData3=sockaddr ptr)
        'rbuf' - set socket recv buffer size
        'sbuf' - set socket send buffer size
        'scbk' - enable/disable "send callbacks usage" on specified socket (defaults to enable)
        'sdcb' - set/unset send callback (iData1=TRUE for set - FALSE for unset, pData2=callback, pData3=callref)
        'spam' - set debug level for debug output
        'vadd' - add a port to virtual port list
        'vdel' - del a port from virtual port list
Version
10/04/1999 (gschaefer)

References SocketStateT::AddrMap, SocketStateT::aSendCbEntries, SocketStateT::aVirtualPorts, SocketT::bAsyncRecv, SocketT::bSendCbs, CALLB_RECV, DS_MAX, FALSE, SocketStateT::hEvent, SocketT::iLastError, SocketStateT::iMaxPacket, SocketStateT::iMemGroup, SocketT::iPacketQueueResizePending, SocketT::iType, SocketT::iVerbose, SocketStateT::iVerbose, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, NetPrintfVerbose, SocketT::pCallback, SocketT::pCallRef, SocketStateT::pMemGroupUserData, SocketT::pNext, SocketT::pRecvQueue, SocketSendCallbackEntryT::pSendCallback, SocketSendCallbackEntryT::pSendCallref, SocketStateT::pSockList, SocketT::RecvCrit, SocketT::RecvRate, SocketT::SendRate, SOCKERR_NONE, SOCKET_MAXUDPRECV, SOCKET_MAXVIRTUALPORTS, SocketAddrMapAddress(), SocketAddrRemapAddress(), SocketAddrUnmapAddress(), SocketPacketQueueAdd(), SocketPacketQueueControl(), SocketPacketQueueResize(), SocketSendCallbackAdd(), SocketSendCallbackRem(), TRUE, SocketStateT::uAdapterAddress, SocketT::uCallMask, SocketRateT::uMaxRate, and SocketT::uSocket.

Referenced by CommUDPControl(), NetConnControl(), ProtoSSLControl(), ProtoTunnelControl(), ProtoTunnelCreate(), and ProtoTunnelDestroy().

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t SocketInfo ( SocketT *  pSocket,
int32_t  iInfo,
int32_t  iData,
void *  pBuf,
int32_t  iLen 
)

Return information about an existing socket.

Parameters
*pSocket- socket reference
iInfo- selector for desired information
iData- selector specific
*pBuf- [out] return buffer
iLen- buffer length
Returns
int32_t - size of returned data or error code (negative value)
Note
iInfo can be one of the following:
        'addr' - return local address
        'conn' - who we are connecting to
        'bind' - return bind data (if pSocket == NULL, get socket bound to given port)
        'bndu' - return bind data (only with pSocket=NULL, get SOCK_DGRAM socket bound to given port)
        'ladr' - get local address previously specified by user for subsequent SocketBind() operations (pc only)
        'maxp' - return configured max packet size
        'maxr' - return configured max recv rate (bytes/sec; zero=uncapped)
        'maxs' - return configured max send rate (bytes/sec; zero=uncapped)
        'pdrp' - return socket packet queue number of packets dropped
        'peer' - peer info (only valid if connected)
        'pmax' - return socket packet queue max depth
        'ratr' - return current recv rate estimation (bytes/sec)
        'rats' - return current send rate estimation (bytes/sec)
        'sdcf' - get installed send callback function pointer (iData specifies index in array)
        'sdcu' - get installed send callback userdata pointer (iData specifies index in array)
        'serr' - last socket error
        'size' - return socket packet queue max size
        'sock' - return windows socket associated with the specified DirtySock socket
        'spam' - return debug level for debug output
        'stat' - TRUE if connected, else FALSE
        'virt' - TRUE if socket is virtual, else FALSE
Version
10/04/1999 (gschaefer)

References SocketStateT::AddrMap, SocketStateT::aSendCbEntries, SocketT::bVirtual, ds_memcpy(), SocketT::iLastError, SocketStateT::iMaxPacket, SocketT::iOpened, SocketT::iProto, SocketT::iType, SocketT::iVerbose, SocketStateT::iVerbose, NetCritEnter(), NetCritLeave(), NetPrintf, NetPrintfVerbose, SocketT::pNext, SocketT::pRecvQueue, SocketSendCallbackEntryT::pSendCallback, SocketSendCallbackEntryT::pSendCallref, SocketStateT::pSockList, SocketT::RecvCrit, SocketT::RecvRate, SocketT::SendRate, SockaddrInGetPort, SockaddrInit, SockaddrInSetAddr, SockaddrInSetPort, SOCKERR_CLOSED, SOCKERR_OTHER, SocketAddrMapAddress(), SocketGetLocalAddr(), SocketHtons(), SocketPacketQueueStatus(), SocketStateT::uAdapterAddress, SocketRateT::uCurRate, SocketRateT::uMaxRate, SocketT::uSocket, and SocketT::uVirtualPort.

)

iFlags- unused

*pFromLen- length of address
Returns

int32_t SocketSendCallbackInvoke ( SocketSendCallbackEntryT  aCbEntries[],

int32_t  iType,
const char *  pBuf,
int32_t  iLen,
const struct sockaddr *  pTo 
)

Invoke all send callbacks in specified collection. Only one of the callback is supposed to return "handled"... warn if not the case.

Parameters

pSocket- socket reference
iType- socket type
*pBuf- the data to be sent
iLen- size of data
*pTo- the address to send to (NULL=use connection address)
Returns

DIRTYCODE_API int32_t SocketSendto ( SocketT *  pSocket,
const char *  pBuf,
int32_t  iLen,
int32_t  iFlags,
const struct sockaddr *  pTo,
int32_t  iToLen 
)

Send data to a remote host. The destination address is supplied along with the data. Should only be used with datagram sockets as stream sockets always send to the connected peer.

*pBuf- the data to be sent

*pTo- the address to send to (NULL=use connection address)
